Summary: Trigger periodic updates with the MauiReactor Timer widget. Bind IsEnabled and Interval, handle OnTick to update state on the UI thread.
Remarks: Use the built-in Timer visual node for MVU-friendly periodic events instead of raw runtime timers. Add Timer anywhere in the component tree. Start/pause with .IsEnabled(bool) and set frequency with .Interval(ms). Handle .OnTick(() => SetState(...)) to drive counters, clocks, or animations. The callback runs on the UI thread, so you can safely update state.
